intro: Spatalla mucronifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and pointed at the tip. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It is native to various regions in Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Spatalla mucronifolia is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand harsh environmental conditions.
